name: Sehome Court Apartments

google_reviews.author: H_Scribbler
google_reviews.review:
Lived here for about two years.

The initial impression was bad - the landlord seemed to not know how to sound anything other than snappy/rude on the phone, almost even condescending.  Thought maybe I was making a mistake, but gave it a try since I like townhome-style apartments.

Location was great - close to WWU, close to grocery stores and restaurants, gas station right around the corner right before easy access to the freeway onramp - and a small farm next door that sold fruits and vegetables - a bonus. Did some walking around at night throughout the year - pretty safe neighbourhood.

Come to think of it I don't think I ever saw the landlord while I lived there - he was like a phantom in the mist - I know he was around the premises from time to time though - to remove snow from the walkways or tape some notices on the door and whatnot.

The maintenance guy deserves most of the credit for my staying there for two years. He was quick to respond to maintenance requests, very efficient, courteous, accomodating and always friendly. Wave and he will definitely wave back.

The unit I was in, had a neighbour who made loud, rhythmical noise all night - made my bedroom feel like a cheap club. Sometimes their pet elephant slammed into the wall and dragged itself along the hallway, or a balled up armadillo bounced down their stairs for the hell of it. Lost many hours of sleep and much, much sanity. However, I am not taking stars out of the apartment because I figured I just drew a short straw.

In the end I have come believe that the landlord is proud of his property since he takes good care of it. He was responsive to my emails/calls, and despite his rather impolite ways, in the end I got used to it and stopped getting offended.

I would definitely go back and live there if I ever return to Bellingham - just not the same unit so I can avoid that neighbour.

google_reviews.author: Kelly Machnik
google_reviews.review: Sehome Court has been a really great place to live for the past four years. The owner and maintenance person are very helpful and responsive. The property is well kept. Maintenance issues are handled immediately. The price is very reasonable for a spacious two bedroom apartment. They are strict with rules regarding parking and smoking but that helps make it a great place to live.

google_reviews.author: Jahnel Burgess
google_reviews.review: Lived in the apartments for 2.5 years and loved it. Very clean and there is an on site maintenance person who will fix any emergency issues and also keep up on all ongoing projects to improve living conditions. Neighbors were kind and respectful, appreciated how the owner screened tenants well. Would highly recommend

google_reviews.author: Cat Lasswell
google_reviews.review: Wonderful apartments! Large and affordable with wonderful staff and maintenance crew. I love that it was pet friendly and even includes basic comcast in the rent! One of the best places i've rented from in Bellingham, hands down.

google_reviews.author: Full Moon
google_reviews.review: I would like to say that the customer service I received while trying to fill out the application was one of the worst experiences I have ever encountered. There were too many red flags with the management. When I was trying to drop off the application papers there was a man in front of the office building who very rudely told me I had to leave and I tried to tell him that I needed to drop off some application papers and he kept interrupting me and telling me to leave. The first time I called them I was being asked personal questions that go against HIPAA. When I was asking him questions that I had about my lease, he made it seem like I was the one who was wasting his time. Ive worked in customer service and the way that the manager talks to the applicants is so unprofessional and condescending. The manager is disrespectful and doesnt know how to run a business. Ive had so many issues

summary:
Disclaimer

This article is generated by ChatGPT and is intended as a tool to assist individuals in finding a property management company or rental property. The summarization of Sehome Court Apartments is based on user reviews and does not contain any identifiable information about the reviewers. This article’s intent is to provide a well-balanced overview of both positive and negative aspects of the property, highlighting specific examples cited by users, without representing the views or opinions of the actual individuals.

The Good

Sehome Court Apartments have received accolades for their exceptional maintenance staff and the responsiveness of the property management team. Users have highlighted the dedication and efficiency of the maintenance person, who is highly complimented for addressing maintenance requests swiftly and courteously. Positive remarks stress the importance of good upkeep and the noticeable efforts to maintain the property well.

Occupants appreciate the location, finding it conveniently close to WWU, shops, restaurants, and quick freeway access. Additionally, the presence of a nearby farm selling fresh produce added an unexpected charm to the residence. Those who lived there for extended periods have felt safe in the neighborhood and found the rules on parking and smoking conducive to a peaceful living environment, indicating a well-regulated property.

The Great

The spaciousness and affordability of the apartments have not gone unnoticed by tenants, with users rating them highly for offering a valuable living space. User reviews reflect a sense of contentment with the size and price ratio, considering it a significant benefit. Furthermore, the pet-friendly policy and inclusive amenities such as basic cable services are details that have been greatly appreciated by the residents, contributing to an overall satisfying experience.

Tenants have voiced their approval of the screening process for new renters, which has ensured a community of respectful and kind neighbors. The consistent high scores in reviews suggest a general consensus that Sehome Court Apartments is one of the better rental options available in Bellingham, with many indicating a willingness to recommend the property to potential renters.

The Bad

Not all interactions with the property management have been favorable, with some users detailing negative experiences. Issues noted include perceived rudeness and condescension from the landlord, particularly over the phone. These unfortunate communication styles appear to have made some potential tenants question their decision to engage with the property. For some, this initial impression has been a notable drawback, contrasting the otherwise positive views of the apartment complex.

Another point of concern raised by a user relates to the inappropriate nature of personal questions asked during the application process, which they felt to be intrusive and unprofessional. Situations where the property manager was seen as disrespectful and difficult to communicate with have also been recounted, leading to stress and dissatisfaction for those involved.

The Ugly

The most severe criticism centers around the behavior of a single individual in a managerial role who was pointedly accused of being disrespectful and unprofessional. These interactions have left some residents and applicants feeling alienated and poorly treated. As social interactions form an integral part of the renting experience, these negative experiences carry considerable weight in the overall perception of the property management.

From the user reviews, it is apparent that certain incidents have contributed to a tarnished reputation for the property management among the affected individuals. Incidences such as alleged rudeness by someone at the front of the building and the property manager's conduct suggest a challenging environment for constructive dialogue and service, potentially diminishing the positive aspects offered by Sehome Court Apartments.
